meanings.definition: The act of selling goods or services.
meanings.sent1: At the market, vendors engage in venditions of fresh produce.
meanings.sent2: Online platforms facilitate venditions of various products to customers worldwide.
meanings.sent3: The vending machine's venditions of snacks always bring joy to hungry students.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiastic venditions of handmade crafts captured the attention of many shoppers.
meanings.sent5: The colorful banners advertising the venditions of toys attracted families to the fair.

meanings.definition: The process of offering items for sale.
meanings.sent1: During the auction, the rapid venditions of rare collectibles amazed the bidders.
meanings.sent2: Successful businesses focus on effective marketing strategies to boost their venditions.
meanings.sent3: The street performer's creative venditions of handmade jewelry drew a crowd.
meanings.sent4: In the bustling marketplace, the constant venditions of fresh flowers added to the vibrant atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The enthusiastic salesman's persuasive venditions of the new product impressed the customers.

meanings.definition: The act of vending or selling products.
meanings.sent1: The company's venditions of electronic gadgets increased their revenue significantly.
meanings.sent2: Street vendors rely on their daily venditions to support their families.
meanings.sent3: The vending machine's unexpected venditions of hot coffee delighted the office workers.
meanings.sent4: His passionate venditions of vintage records attracted music enthusiasts to his store.
meanings.sent5: The enthusiastic entrepreneur's innovative venditions of eco-friendly products gained popularity among consumers.
